channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed

item.title: "The Delays Have Been Unacceptable" - The Wait Continues For Rock It Games' Croc Physical
item.content:encoded:
Poor old Croc: Legend of the Gobbos. The Argonaut Games remaster arrived on Switch on 2nd April, the very same day that we were all distracted by the monster Switch 2 reveal Direct, and those who pre-ordered the physical edition way back in Oct 2024 still have no idea when it's going to arrive. Talk about a Croc-y start.

The game itself was delayed back in late 2024. After launch, Rock It Games, the company behind the physical, said that tariff issues had "made it temporarily difficult to schedule shipments for some items," but things were supposedly back on track. Then, following the release of the game's 'Platinum Edition' update last October, the company pushed things again to get the whole game complete on cartridge — "the unavoidable consequence of this upgrade meant delays in the mastering, approval process and physical manufacture of the disc and cartridge with Sony and Nintendo respectively."

So, where does that leave things now? In a new blog post, Rock It says that "the delays have been unacceptable," and that going forward, it will be committed to "only offering games once development is complete and our delivery timelines are fully under our control." But there's still no firm release date.

According to the post, the game disc and cartridges have now been approved for production by Sony and Nintendo, Platinum Edition update included, and much of the extra merch found in the beefy Collector's Editions is either complete or arriving in the warehouse by the end of the month.

The thing is, the production updates aren't consistent between posts — one month, items are complete and ready to go, the next, they're not. Mix-ups happen, of course, but those who dropped $129.99 on the Collector's Edition over a year ago are, rightly, after something a little more concrete.

"I have zero trust in Rock It Games because of this," one user wrote on the r/CrocLegendoftheGobbos Reddit, "If they would have just told the truth, and admitted things got screwed up, and didn't go to plan, I would have been disappointed, but understood." Others have been so frustrated with the process that they have already requested refunds.

"We’re confident that the regular and Collector’s Editions of Croc are coming soon," developer Argonaut Games said in an update post on Instagram, "We’re as eager to receive them as all of our customers are!"

When exactly "soon" is remains to be seen, but hey, maybe 2026 will be the year!

Are you waiting on a Croc physical edition? Let us know in the comments.

[source rockitgames.com, via bsky.app]



https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2026/01/the-delays-have-been-unacceptable-the-wait-continues-for-rock-it-games-croc-physical
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: "It is out of the question to let a boss run rampant" - Ubisoft workers strike against "disastrous" cutbacks
item.content:encoded:
Publisher's RTO announcement decried as effort to "destroy our working conditions"

Ubisoft’s bloodbath of game cancellations and restructuring yesterday has attracted the expected fiery response from unionised workers, with the French game industry union Solidaires Informatique calling a half-day strike today. Cost-cutting and potential layoffs aside, the strikers are protesting against Ubisoft’s decision to mandate a full return to office, with workers given an annual allowance of work from home days instead - something a publisher executive has justified as a move “to enhance collective efficiency” and “the sense of belonging”.

Ubisoft management’s latest bout of corpobutchery has seen them bin off six games, including the Prince Of Persia: The Sands Of Time remake, delay seven others, and confirm the closure of Ubisoft Stockholm.

More layoffs will follow, though Ubisoft have yet to share any precise numbers. It’s all part of the company’s Age of Sigmar-esque transformation into a collection of “Creative Houses” with heavy investment from Tencent, dedicated to a smaller number of hopefully better-selling games – in particular, open world and live service projects, with generative AI dutifully touted as a means of boosting production.

As part of this transition, Ubisoft recently shuttered Ubisoft Halifax (a few weeks after the studio voted to unionise – no connection, they insist) and announced layoffs at Tom Clancy’s The Division developers Massive.

In a statement, Solidaires Informatique describe today’s strike as "an initial response to the absurdity of management decisions”, with more action probably to follow. "It is out of the question to let a boss run rampant and destroy our working conditions,” they write, addressing Ubisoft CEO Yves Guillemot. “Perhaps he needs to be reminded that it is his employees who make the games." The union are also calling for “decent pay rises this year” and “maintaining and extending the teleworking conditions”.

RTO policies are frequently the focus of union action. In October 2024, 700 Ubisoft staff went on strike over a requirement to work in-office three days a week.

Detractors of remote working argue that it’s less efficient and hinders teamwork. As Ubisoft’s senior vice-president of studio operations Marie-Sophie de Waubert told GamesIndustry yesterday, “the one and only objective [for the new RTO policy] is to enhance collective efficiency, to drive the dynamics, the creativity, the sense of belonging.”

Advocates for remote working argue that it doesn’t materially affect how much workers contribute, and that it can be vital for people with disabilities, family commitments and other practical challenges that make commuting or sharing office space unfeasible. When EA implemented a partial return to the office in May last year, anonymous staff offered childcare, medical conditions, and long commutes as reasons for needing an exemption from in-office work.

Advocates for remote working also argue that forbidding hybrid or full remote-working is a “soft layoff” strategy, since some remote workers may have no choice but to move on. That was the claim levelled at Microsoft last September, when they imposed a return to the office following thousands of layoffs.

I am very much Team Homeworking, inasmuch as I couldn’t do this job if I had to work in-office 9-5. In general, I think RTO mandates reflect an unexamined belief among managers that people become shirkers and layabouts unless they're kept firmly inside the panopticon.

Arguments continue about RTO beyond Ubisoft. Rockstar’s recent implementation of RTO in the name of “quality and polish” is one of the reasons some GTA 6 workers chose to unionise, shortly before Rockstar laid off a number of workers for “gross misconduct”, in what British unions have called a case of “union-busting”.



https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/it-is-out-of-the-question-to-let-a-boss-run-rampant-ubisoft-workers-strike-against-disastrous-cutbacks
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Ubisoft Shares Crash by 30% After Restructure News
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft’s shares have plummeted by over 30% today after news of a major restructuring broke.

Ubisoft recently announced a significant restructuring that will focus on a new operating model emphasizing open-world adventures and games-as-a-service (GaaS) experiences. This news has evidently affected the company’s stock, leading to a considerable drop in share value today.

As revealed on Google Finance, Ubisoft’s shares have decreased by 33.78% today (as of the time of writing). The day began with a share price of 5.26 EUR, which has now fallen to 4.44 EUR. Over the past six months, the shares have declined by more than 50%.

The drop comes immediately after the announcement of an organizational, operational, and portfolio reset, which led to the cancellation of highly anticipated titles like the Prince of Persia Remake, among others. The restructuring has also led to the closure of multiple studios and layoffs across the organization.

Ubisoft’s new operating model now features a decentralised structure with 5 Creative Houses, each divided by distinctive genres. The goal is to make the company “a more gamer-centric organization, structured around creative genres.”

Additionally, their new model will be supported by targeted investments, deeper specialization, and cutting-edge technology, which includes “accelerated investments in player-facing Generative AI.”

In other news, Insider Gaming’s exclusive report reveals that Beyond Good & Evil 2 has survived the latest round of project cancellations. Additionally, the restructure has likely led to the Black Flag remake being delayed by up to one year. What are your thoughts on Ubisoft’s shares crashing after the restructuring announcement? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about modders working hard to bring the world of Pokémon into Hytale. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Free new Mario Kart World update adds team races to its Knockout Tour mode
item.content:encoded:
Nintendo has released a free update for Mario Kart World, which adds team races to its chaotic Knockout Tour mode.

In Knockout Tour, players race to not just win, but to stay in the game at all. If you fail to reach a checkpoint ahead of a set number of others, you will be - as the name suggests - knocked out of the running.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

Until now, this had been a solo affair, however Nintendo has now made it so you can race as a team with your friends and family. In the words of Nintendo: "Buddy up and barrel forward!"

So, how does this new team-based Knockout Tour actually work in practice? Well, it's still going to have 24 racers, but up to four teams can now take part. What this means is that you can expect to see a 12v12 race, an 8v8v8 race, or a 6v6v6v6 race. If you don't have enough players to fill all the spots, then CPU characters pop in.

The winner at the end of this flavour of Knockout race is then determined not by who finishes first, but by the total points tally of every member in the team. Points are awarded based on the overall placement of each driver on the team, 50 points for first place, 40 for second, 35 for third and 30 for fourth place. Meanwhile, those who finish towards the end of the pack get less points, with the four drivers who fail to make it past the first checkpoint only getting a scant one point to their names.

So, even if you are an absolute racing super star, and make it to that shiny first place spot, your team may overall still fail to claim victory. Meanwhile, if you happen to be knocked out from the race earlier than you may have liked, you can then watch from the sidelines to spur your team mates on.

For more on this update, you can check out the full Mario Kart World version 1.5.0 patch notes below:

General

  • Added team races to Knockout Tour when playing in a room during "Online Play" and "Wireless Play".
  • The game now supports the Polish language (Note: You can change your selected language using the "Language" setting in the "System" menu of "System Settings".)

Fixed Issues

  • Fixed an issue where the game would sometimes end if a player plays as Kamek on Choco Mountain.
  • Fixed an issue where the displayed rating would sometimes be incorrect when joining "Everyone" in "Online Play" while in a room.
  • Several other issues have been addressed to improve the gameplay experience.

If you are still on the fence about giving Mario Kart World a spin, be sure to check out Eurogamer's review, where our Tom remarked how the game "offers neat twists on the classic Mario Kart formula", calling it all "entertaining, snackable, fun".

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/free-new-mario-kart-world-update-adds-team-races-to-its-knockout-tour-mode
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: ‘It’s Our Most Ambitious Game by a Factor of 10’, Says inXile CEO of Clockwork Revolution
item.content:encoded:
It's been over half a year since we had any update from developer inXile on their next game, the steampunk RPG Clockwork Revolution. Following a new trailer shown at the 2025 Xbox Game Showcase in June, inXile founder and CEO Brian Fargo had claimed the game would feature 'truly evil' options for players and multi-person dialogues.

Now, Fargo has been featured in a new interview published by GamesRadar in which he described Clockwork Revolution as the studio's most ambitious game 'probably by a factor of 10', on account of them trying to translate the level of interactivity usually seen in isometric games into a first-person action RPG.

Elsewhere in the interview, Fargo once again stressed the importance of building truly alternative options for players to choose, even if that means creating more content that can be seen in a single playthrough.

For me, roleplaying means I can play a role and actually affect the world around me. If all paths lead to the same outcome, the immersion breaks, and you start to feel like you're just playing a game rather than living in one. But when the world is constantly reacting and reflecting your choices, both in big ways and just as importantly in small ways, that's when immersion really sets in.

We probably build roughly 30% more content than what any player could see in a single playthrough. We want players to be able to approach the game as a different archetype, whether you want to be good, evil, or something in between. Here's what's really important to us: if you don't allow the player to be bad, to really go down those rabbit holes and see the consequences play out, then they never had free will to be good in the first place. They're not choosing to be good, they're just being forced down a path. We think it's essential that players are making that choice, not having it made for them. We also have a very dark sense of humor, which makes all of it even more fun.

Clockwork Revolution was first showcased during the 2023 Xbox Games Showcase. The game doesn't have a release date, so unless Microsoft and inXile are secretly planning a late 2026 launch, we're probably going to have to wait until 2027 to play it. As a reminder, inXile's previous game, Wasteland 3, was released in August 2020.

The game is currently announced for PC and Xbox Series S and X, although given Microsoft's multiplatform policy, it's only a matter of time before it eventually lands on PlayStation 5, too.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/clockwork-revolution-is-inxiles-most-ambitious-game-by-factor-10/
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Nexus Mods' latest modathon isn't a typical modathon, it's a first go at the same for multi-mod collections
item.content:encoded:
As the modding hosts continue to encourage giving one-click mod collections a go

With their latest Fallout modathon having wrapped up at the close of last year, mod-hosting site Nexus Mods have decided to try something new with their latest event designed to supercharge mod creation around a specific game or theme. Rather than asking folks to submit fresh individual mods like usual, the modathon that's about to kick off is all about putting together chunky multi-mod lists which can overhaul a game in one fell swoop.

These user-assembled modlists, dubbed Collections, are a feature Nexus Mods have been pushing for a number of years now, so it's not surprising they're now serving as the subject of a modathon for the first time.

Set to run from January 26th to February 8th, the first "Collectionathon" is a Fallout-themed one, with season two of a certain radioactive TV show putting out the remainder of its weekly episodes in the coming weeks.

"We want to see you reimagine the Wasteland in bold new ways, whether that’s by taking one of your favourite games from the series and amping it up or by bringing the world of Fallout to a brand new title," reads the brief from the nexus of modders. "Through survival overhauls, lore-friendly refreshes, or wild experiments, we want to see it all, and whatever your idea, we can’t wait to see your creativity in action!"

If you fancy getting involved, you'll need to do so via Vortex, Nexus Mods' Windows-only mod manager. As a bit of extra context, Vortex is now the only mod manager the mod hosts are working on, with them having announced plans to can development of a multiplatform Nexus Mods App earlier this month. Central to the pitch behind that app was the idea it'd work on the likes of the Steam Deck and PCs running Linux. Though, Nexus Mods haven't totally ruled out that functionality potentially making its way to Vortex further down the line.

"We’re also exploring what Linux support might look like for Vortex in the future," Nexus mods owner Victor Folmann wrote in a post about the decision. "While getting every game and mod working on Linux might not be possible, it’s an area we want to keep evaluating where it makes sense."

While I can see the appeal of curated modlists designed for folks to be able to install in one click, having dabbled a bit with Vortex during my early modding days, I can't say I've ever given one of these collections a proper go. I momentarily considered it when setting up my last Cyberpunk 2077 run, but instead chose simply to install manually so I could stick exclusively to mods I wanted and regularly pause to check everything was working as intended as my load order grew.

To be fair, I was benefitting from years worth of built-up knowledge in terms of mod installation and what's out there Cyberpunk mod-wise, so I might simply not be in main target audience for collections at this point. Still, it's a lot of faith to be putting in the people who curate such lists to keep them up to date and regularly tested. Then again, that's arguably the same sort of trust you have to put in mod creators anyway, if you're installing works one-by-one.

As of writing, Fallout 4's already got just over 2,200 collections, while New Vegas has 961, and Fallout 3 99. We'll have to see what sort of boost this collection jam gives to those numbers.



https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/nexus-mods-latest-modathon-isnt-a-typical-modathon-its-a-first-go-at-the-same-for-multi-mod-collections
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Pokémon Is Coming To Hytale Through Mods
item.content:encoded:
The world of Hytale continues to get bigger and better, pushed by regular updates from Hypixel Studios and modders around the world, the latter of whom have revealed work on a significant collab.

Along with the reveal of the second major update following Hytale’s early access launch, modders have revealed some early work of plans to bring Pokémon into the game, and it looks fantastic.

Hytale Modders Adding Pokémon

A teaser showcase of completed work from the Pokéfind team was posted on X, revealing models for the Kanto starters and their complete evolution lines, featuring the likes of Blastoise, Charizard, Squirtle, and Bulbasaur.

Pokéfind has already found a home in Minecraft, offering a variety of experiences, including a Pokémon Survival mode, a custom-built Pokémon region, Pokémon Skyblock, and Pokéwars, and the plans are to offer similar experiences in Hytale.

The social media post stated the team behind the mod is “beyond excited” to bring Pokéfind into Hytale, teasing that “big updates” are coming.

No timeline has been shared for when players will be able to jump into the game, and, due to licensing, it’s unlikely the mod will be available on official channels like Curseforge. Instead, additional steps are likely to be required to access the game.

Pokéfind is easy to play on Minecraft, however, so there shouldn’t be any issues for players jumping into the mod when it is made available, and you can keep an eye on the team’s progression in development by following the social media account.

What mods do you want to see added to Hytale? Share your ideas in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Hytale, check out the list of games to play if you enjoy Hytale, and find out about the Hytale & Minecraft crossplay mod being developed.

item.title: Arknights Endfield Devs Warn Against PayPal Payments Amid Hack Reports
item.content:encoded:
Hypergryph has revealed that Arknights Endfield’s PayPal channel is undergoing maintenance, as reports about hacks have started emerging from players.

The latest free-to-play, sci-fi gacha, action RPG by Hypergryph and Gryphline, Arknights Endfield, released today for PlayStation 5, PC, and mobile devices. However, it seems a significant issue has arisen on launch day, with players complaining that their PayPal accounts are being used to make unauthorised purchases.

Players across X (formerly Twitter) are reporting hacks involving PayPal purchases in Arknights: Endfield. A user named Naru has shared information about unauthorized transactions made on a victim’s PayPal account, all linked to Gryph Frontier PTE. LTD. The charges appear in multiple currencies, including USD, JPY, CAD, and EURO, and victims are being charged multiple times for a single purchase.

The official Arknights Endfield X account has announced that they are currently conducting temporary maintenance on the PayPal payment channel due to reports of issues. Players are advised to use alternative payment methods during this time. The account has also stated that “transactions involving abnormal item delivery or payment deductions will be addressed accordingly.” However, many players in the comments are still expressing concerns about unauthorized purchases.

In other news, check out the system requirements for Arknight Endfield. Additionally, here’s how you can earn Twitch Drops for the game. What are your thoughts on the Arknight Endfield PayPal issue? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Hytale Update 2 patch notes and release date. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: If you want Gears of War to return to the "tone and vibes of the original games" E-Day sounds like it's doing just that
item.content:encoded:
Re-emerging for an interview.

In a new interview, Gears of War E-Day creative director Matt Searcy has peeled back the curtain a little on the upcoming prequel to everyone's favourite gory third-person shooter. Namely, that by returning to Emergence Day the original series' vibes will return.

Speaking to GamesRadar +, Searcy spoke at length about what returning to a core moment in Gears history allowed the team to explore: ""This is the story we were excited to tell and so the process has been super energizing. There are touchpoints in the lore for us to build from, but enough room that we get to bring new elements and ideas in.

Searcy elaborates: "Getting to go back to the tone and vibes of the original games, exploring the details of Emergence, and imagining what would happen to a city (and the soldiers protecting it) as monsters poured out from the ground was a great starting point to reintroduce the Locust and these characters"

The game, which will be set in the city of Kalona over the course of a few consecutive days, will focus heavily on the shock of Locust forces popping up and causing havoc for the first time. According to Searcy, it'll be quite an emotionally charged experience as well as an action-packed one.

"Our story is set over consecutive days so that players can become intimate with the city," Searcy states. "We want them to feel the loss of what was here: the history, the people, and the lives they were living.

"We think it has the potential to be one of the best stories in the Gears franchise, and certainly the most heart and emotion when you're looking at Marcus, Dom, and the origin of the brotherhood that they forge in this game."

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/gears-of-war-e-day-original-series-tone
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: A 'World Class' Pokémon Attraction Is Coming To Universal Studios
item.content:encoded:
Japan first, then global

The Pokémon Company and Universal Studios have announced that a 'world class' Pokémon attraction will be coming to Universal Studios themes parks in Japan and global locations.

Described as an 'interactive Pokémon experience' that will "stimulate all five senses", the attraction will debut at Universal Studios Japan in Osaka before being rolled out globally. This presumably includes parks in Orlando and Los Angeles in the US along with Singapore and Beijing.

Tsunekazu Ishihara, President and CEO of The Pokémon Company, had the following to say:

"Since announcing our medium- to long-term alliance in 2021, we have collaborated with Universal Studios Japan's outstanding creative vision and world-class technical capabilities to produce a variety of 'real-life Pokémon experiences,' including the NO LIMIT! Parade and Halloween show.

"This year marks the 30th anniversary of Pokémon, and we are extremely pleased to be able to fully launch this new project with you all at this major milestone. Our mission is to enrich both the real and virtual worlds through the existence of Pokémon, and we produce Pokémon every day. With this project, too, we hope to create new entertainment that is unique to theme parks, as a rich experience in the real world, and continue to provide surprises to people all over the world."

There's no time scale as to when the attraction will launch, but those in Japan can at least look forward to the opening of Poké Park Kanto at Tokyo's Yomiuriland Amusement Park on 5th February 2026.

In the meantime, we'll keep an eye out any further developments regarding the new Pokémon attraction at Universal Studios. If nothing else, we're expecting to see lots and lots (and lots) of new merch.

What do you make of this? Will you be keen to visit one of the Universal Studios destinations when the Pokémon attraction launches? Let us know with a comment.

[source prtimes.jp]

Nintendo Life’s resident horror fanatic, when he’s not knee-deep in Resident Evil and Silent Hill lore, Ollie likes to dive into a good horror book while nursing a lovely cup of tea. He also enjoys long walks and listens to everything from TOOL to Chuck Berry.

item.title: Complete Highguard Trophy List—How To Get All Achievements & Trophies
item.content:encoded:
Up until launch, there’s been a mystery surrounding Highguard, but some of the best information surrounding the game came from an unlikely place. The full trophy list has been revealed for Highguard, and it looks like there’s going to be a lot to unpack.

When it was revealed as the final game at the 2025 Game Awards, it’s fair to say that people were underwhelmed to see another free-to-play hero-shooter. However, it’s been developed by some of the masterminds behind Apex Legends and Titanfall, so it deserves a fair chance in the spotlight.

If you’re planning on giving Highguard a chance, here’s the full Trophy list you can work on completing during the raids.

All Highguard Trophies & Achievements

Judging by the Trophy list, it doesn’t seem like you’ll need to sink an overwhelming amount of time into Highguard to 100% it.

Considering it’s a multiplayer shooter, you’ll need to perform certain feats during an online match, but there’s nothing outrageous that demands an elite calibre of skill. A lot of them simply need you to complete matches—that shouldn’t be too hard, right?

That’s enough preamble, though. Here’s the complete Highguard Trophy list from start to finish.

How Many Achievements & Trophies Does Highguard Have?

Highguard has 33 PlayStation Trophies and 32 Xbox Achievements for you to earn.

As usual, PlayStation has one extra Trophy thanks to its ever-coveted Platinum Trophy, which sadly aren’t available to you Xbox gamers out there. But there’s still a healthy batch of Achievements to grind towards, and none of them seem too intensive. Get them all done, and your Gamerscore should rise by a fair amount.

Do you intend to earn all of the Trophies for Highguard? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Highguard, check out all the details surrounding its free-to-play status, as well as what platforms it’s available on.

item.title: Hytale Update 2 Patch Notes And Release Date—New Magic, Mining Overhauled & More
item.content:encoded:
You can’t sit still in Hytale before something else changes! Hytale’s founder promised constant improvements, and Update 2 brings new gameplay mechanics, dozens of fixes, and so much more in its January patch notes.

Hytale’s popularity remains strong in its early weeks. This is being helped by the game’s frequent updates and patch notes. Initial changes included adding Dinosaurs, for example. Hytale Update 2 is another fairly hefty proposition, and there’s much to look forward to and discuss.

Hytale Update 2 Release Date

Hytale founder Simon Collins-Laflamme has said Update 2 is arriving “this weekend,” which means it’ll drop between January 23 and January 25.

To add to this, he’s already confirmed that “Update 3 is already in the works,” and the grind never stops!”

Biggest Changes In Hytale Update 2

Pickaxe progression and Mining have been reworked, and new Magic is being added to Hytale, along with a host of cosmetic and customization changes. There are also tons of gameplay fixes, balance tweaks, and overall QOL improvements across visual and audio.

It’s a fairly meaty update that targets all aspects of Hytale. Obviously, the standout aspects of Update 2 are the physical gameplay flourishes. New magic will sharpen up and broaden the action, making it even more fun.

Collins-Laflamme recently revealed he wasn’t happy with the state of the game’s Mining, which is why it’s not a surprise to see how it’s been changed in Update 2: “Pickaxe progression reworked: mining speed now scales with pickaxe quality.”

All Hytale Update 2 Patch Notes

Here’s a look at every single change outlined for Update 2, and there’s always the chance something sneaks under the radar, gets left out, or might not make the final cut by the time the full update launches.

Cosmetics & Customization

New mask face accessories (available for all editions)

  • Armor slot visibility toggle (host-enforced for PvP/immersion)
  • New mouth variants: Vampire, Cute, Orc (all editions)
  • Berserker haircut tiling fixed
  • Updated haircuts, cape animations, petals & cloth visuals

Gameplay & Balance

  • New magic! Necromancy grimoire! Drops from Skeleton Praetorian, lets you raise up to 5 skeletal minions from bone piles (5-min duration or until summoner dies)
  • Adamantite now requires a Thorium or Cobalt pickaxe
  • Pickaxe progression reworked: mining speed now scales with pickaxe quality
  • Faster rail karts (still not great, but faster!)
  • Tower exploit fixed (NPCs can now throw rocks at players)
  • Buffed polar bears and multiple skeleton types
  • All crops can now place produce in the world
  • Missing decorative light blocks added to furniture bench
  • Adjusted hide drops (Light → Medium for some NPCs like cows)
  • Added permission for world map teleporting
  • Magma Rhino Toad attack updates (…maybe accidental buff)

World Generation

  • WorldGen V2 prepared for public documentation (modder support)
  • New Default_Flat & Default_Void templates using WorldGen V2
  • Hub Portal now spawns with V2 flat worldgen (clear weather, limited fog, new worlds only)
  • Major ore placement refactor in all zones – More ores, especially in Devastated Lands underground – Requires new chunks in existing worlds
  • Zone 1 dungeon environment fixes + new environment fixes (you might hear new soundtracks)

Farming

  • Eternal crops no longer break from weapon damage
  • Increased tilled soil lifetime
  • Fixed soil decay under fully grown crops

UI / UX

  • Improved editor block tooltips
  • Clothing color tooltips added
  • Better hotbar active-slot contrast (diamond indicator, helpful in Howling Sands)
  • Memory categories sorted alphabetically
  • Scripted Brush QoL improvements
  • Inventory interaction updates (e.g. new keybind to pull all items from chests)
  • Optional FPS counter overlay
  • Player markers added to compass
  • Ophidiophobia accessibility mode

Audio

  • Added basic Rex sounds + additional audio fixes

Bug Fixes, Tech & Stability

  • Server self-updater
  • Shadow improvements
  • Pick block works when hotbar is full
  • Asset editor documentation fixed
  • Mantling fixes
  • Keybind persistence fixed
  • Improved weather transitions (still not perfect, but smoother)
  • Teleporter offset fixed
  • Rail karts now consume & place correctly
  • Bed respawn in unloaded chunks fixed
  • Food particle tint updates
  • Major server stability, validation, ECS, localization & timeout improvements

Thanks to @Simon_Hypixel for the patch notes.

Are you excited about the prospect of Hytale’s Update 2? What are you hoping and praying to see from Update 3? Comment your feedback through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

You should check out the 8 best games to play if you like Hytale, and the Hytale & Minecraft user-made Crossplay Mod in development.

item.title: Highguard Trophy List Has Revealed More Details Than The Devs Have
item.content:encoded:
Highguard’s Trophy List has surfaced online, revealing the most information about the game we have received yet, including mechanics, game modes, and more.

The upcoming free-to-play, PvP raid shooter by Wildlight Entertainment, Highguard, was revealed during The Game Awards 2026, with a brand new flashy trailer. However, since then, the game’s marketing has been almost nonexistent, with virtually no information revealed 4 days before its release. Interestingly, the Highguard Trophy List is doing the job for them.

Highguard Trophy List Reveals Brand New Details

There is a wealth of information contained in Highguard’s Trophy List, which was discovered on Exophase. This list covers various aspects of the game, including mechanics, game systems, characters, and more. It mentions features such as Shieldbreakers, Domesplitter, Revivals, Enemy Orbs, Wall Breaking, and Generators. Additionally, the list includes the names of certain weapons, like the BigRig LMG. Furthermore, it highlights other items, including chests, Rare & Legendary items, and more.

The trophy list also goes through all the different types of Wardens in the game, including Assault Warden, Defensive Warden, Recon Warden, Support Warden, and Destruction Warden. Interested readers can check out Insider Gaming’s Highguard Trophy guide here.

Highguard has some big names attached to it, with the creators of Apex Legends and Titanfall working on the title. However, even though the game is set to release on January 26, 2026, the game’s official YouTube channel has just one video: the reveal trailer shown at The Game Awards. Players have been waiting for more information on the title, but it seems the trophy list might have to suffice until release.

In other news, Highguard developers did not pay for the spot at The Game Awards finale. Additionally, some players suspect that the title could flop. What are your thoughts on Highguard’s trophy list revealing more details than the devs have? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Forza Horizon 6’s release date and early access details being confirmed. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Fortnite Festival’s Next Major Collab May Have Been Found
item.content:encoded:
The next star of Fortnite Festival may have been uncovered by dataminers, suggesting that the Pink Pony Club could be on it’s way to the game.

Season 12 in Fortnite, starring LISA, is heading toward a conclusion, having been in the game since November 2025, and the end date of February 5 is right around the corner. Now, it appears her successor has been uncovered.

Chappell Roan Potentially Coming to Fortnite

Hints that Chappel Roan is coming to Fortnite have been uncovered by Itsmeleaky on X, who uncovered items in the games files that hint towards the pop star entering the fray.

A microphone and drumset have been discovered in Fortnite’s files, but the biggest hint ofall comes from a significant makeover to the beloved Fortnite llama, which appears to have been inducted into the Pink Pony Club.

The design of the llama looks extremely close to the horse that Chappel Roan has utilized in her concerts around the world, and is therefore a direct hint at the collab.

However, SpushFNBR, who shared the image, added that the collab was not confirmed, and, while the items were found in files, the headliner for the next season of Fortnite Festival could be changed.

If Chappell Roan were to star as the headliner of the next Fortnite Festival season, she would add to the library of Jam Tracks in the game, which already includes hits The Giver, Hot to Go, and Good Luck, Babe!

Would Chappell Roan be a good choice for the headliner in the next Fortnite Festival season? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, take a look at the details of the Dungeons & Dragons collab added to the game, and find out about Fortnite’s new Crown Jam game mode.

item.title: Sands of Time's shock cancellation "does not mean we are stepping away from the franchise", says remake team
item.content:encoded:
Prince of Persia "as a universe and a legacy" continues to "matter deeply".

Ubisoft's Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake studio has shared a statement following its game's shock cancellation.

Last night, Ubisoft announced a "major organisational, operational and portfolio reset", which saw the company delay seven unspecified projects, close two studios and cancel multiple games. One such game was its Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake, which was unveiled in 2020, and had suffered numerous delays and setbacks since. Then, this week, came the final nail in the coffin.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

The team behind Prince of Persia's embattled remake has now shared a few words of its own. Here, the studio acknowledged the cancellation was "deeply disappointing" for fans as well as the development team, however this "does not mean [its] stepping away from the franchise" for good.

In a social media post, Ubisoft's Prince of Persia: Sands of Time Remake studio wrote: "The game holds enormous meaning for fans and for the teams who worked on it.

"While the project had real potential, we weren't able to reach the level of quality you deserve, and continuing would have required more time and investment than we could reasonably commit. And, we didn't want to release something that fell short of what The Sands of Time represents."

It stated Prince of Persia "as a universe and a legacy" is still important to the studio, and Sands of Time's cancellation does not mean this is the end for the franchise as a whole. Closing, Ubisoft's studio thanked the community for its "passion, patience and love for Prince of Persia".

Many were surprised to learn Ubisoft was pulling the plug on its Sands of Time remake. Recent reports from the company had the game slated for release during"Q4" of its current financial year, which comes to an end on 31st March. So, in just a couple of months.

In June of last year, the Sands of Time remake was said to be "deep in development", after the project moved from its original developers Ubisoft Pune and Mumbai to Ubisoft Montreal, where it was seemingly rebooted from scratch.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/sands-of-times-shock-cancellation-does-not-mean-we-are-stepping-away-from-the-franchise-says-remake-team

item.title: Final Fantasy VII Rebirth Should Still Launch This Year on Xbox Series & Nintendo Switch 2, Says Insider
item.content:encoded:
• 0-20%: Unlikely - Lacks credible sources
  • 21-40%: Questionable - Some concerns remain
  • 41-60%: Plausible - Reasonable evidence
  • 61-80%: Probable - Strong evidence
  • 81-100%: Highly Likely - Multiple reliable sources

In September 2025, insider Nate the Hate (who just won the 'Leaker of the Year' award as voted by Reddit's GamingLeaksAndRumors) shared the rumor that Final Fantasy VII Rebirth, the second installment in the Final Fantasy VII remake trilogy, would launch this year on Microsoft's Xbox Series S and X and Nintendo Switch 2. It seems Square Enix's plan in this regard hasn't changed, at least according to the insider, who confirmed it on X in response to a follower's question.

If true, it would mean that Xbox and Nintendo gamers are getting both released games in the trilogy in the same year. The first one, Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade, is launching today on both platforms. Last month, the publisher released a free demo that stunned gamers particularly for its great visuals and performance on the Nintendo Switch 2, which almost looked on par with the PlayStation 5 version. The developer had previously also spoken well of the Xbox Series S, saying they had no problem porting FFVII Remake Integrade to the platform, except for a few memory-related challenges.

Porting Final Fantasy VII Rebirth will undoubtedly be more challenging, though, especially for the Xbox Series S and Nintendo Switch 2. The more recent game has a far larger scope and open world-like environments that will be quite taxing on the CPU, unlike the first game's fairly linear maps. Because of this, a 2026 launch would be all the more impressive, provided it is decently optimized. For comparison, the game is playable on the Steam Deck, but only with some major performance and graphics caveats.

Series aficionados are also waiting with bated breath for news about Final Fantasy VII Remake Part 3. Last month, director Naoki Hamauguchi teased that it was almost time for its unveiling, and fans thought it would happen at The Game Awards 2025, but it didn't. That said, it could be shown at the next State of Play, whenever that will be. As with previous games, the game will likely launch on Sony's PlayStation 5 first.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/final-fantasy-vii-rebirth-should-launch-this-year-xbox-switch-2/

item.title: Forza Horizon 6 Release Date Confirmed, Has 4-Day Early Access
item.content:encoded:
Forza Horizon 6’s release date has been confirmed just hours before the upcoming Xbox Developer Direct, with the game releasing on May 19, 2026.

A little over a week ago, a screenshot had appeared revealing details about Playground Games’ upcoming title, Forza Horizon 6. The screenshot provides essential details, including the release date, early access information, and what you can get with the Premium Edition. Now, a reliable source has confirmed all of these details.

Forza Horizon 6 Releases May 2026

The confirmation about Forza Horizon 6’s release date comes from a new report by Dealabs. The report reveals that the release date is indeed set for May 19, 2026, for both the Standard Edition and the Deluxe Edition. Players who purchase the Premium Edition will receive 4 days of Early Access, with the game becoming accessible on May 15, 2026.

Forza Horizon 6’s standard edition has been priced at €69.99 in Europe and $69.99 in the United States. The game will also receive a physical release for the Xbox Series X; however, it will only be available for the Standard edition and will arrive on May 19, 2026, as well. Forza Horizon 6 pre-orders will start one hour after the Xbox Developer Direct today.

Moreover, the Premium Edition bonuses revealed in the earlier screenshot were accurate as well, with players receiving a VIP Membership, Welcome Pack, Car Pass, and Time Attack Car Pack. Additional packs will also be released post-launch. Details about the deluxe edition weren’t revealed.

In other news, here are the details on whether Forza Horizon 6 will be available on PlayStation 5. Additionally, learn more about the game’s new location. What are your thoughts on Forza Horizon 6’s release date being confirmed? Would you be pre-ordering today? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Starfield co-lead designer reflecting on the game’s shortcomings. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: BF Labs Players Will Get First Crack at Testing Battlefield 6’s New Season 2 Map and a BF4 Map That’s Being “Rebuilt for Today’s Battlefield”
item.content:encoded:
After an extremely strong launch that carried it to become one of the best-selling games of 2025, Battlefield 6 could not have gotten off to a worse start to 2026 than by delaying the arrival of Season 2. If you can't wait for the entire extra month it'll now take to arrive, then the clear answer is to do everything you can to get into Battlefield Labs, as EA announced that players participating in BF Labs will get to test out Season 2's new map, Contaminated, and everyone's favourite mini helicopter, Little Bird.

Those are just two of the main additions coming in Season 2 that BF Labs players will get their hands on first, as EA and Battlefield Studios continue to test and tweak things for the upcoming season. In a blog post on the game's official website, the BF Studios team outlined that the new map falls somewhere between the size of Eastwood and Mirak Valley. To give you a potentially better idea of how big it is, the team adds that it's "comparable" to maps like St. Quentin Scar from Battlefield 1 or Arras from Battlefield V.

Contaminated and Little Bird are all that BF Labs players will be testing in the next session EA hosts, but the BF Studios team is quick to point out it'll be doing a lot more testing, and that future tests will be "more exploratory," including testing out different aircraft and vehicle systems. There are also adjustments to RPGs and vehicle interactions incoming, to potentially re-tune how vehicles can respond to RPGs and TOW launchers, and how those weapons impact vehicles.

There are other changes not outlined in the blog post that EA and BF Studios say will arrive in time for Season 2, and there are even more changes that won't arrive until after Season 2. Including the return of a Battlefield 4 map that EA and BF Studios call a "fan-favorite" map: Golmud Railway.

"Golmud Railway is being rebuilt for today’s Battlefield, not simply ported forward," the blog post reads. "Our goal is to preserve what made the map so memorable in Battlefield 4, particularly its combined arms gameplay, while improving how it plays and supports Battlefield 6 systems. Golmud is planned to be the largest Battlefield 6 map to date, giving us the opportunity to expand gameplay on a larger scale."

"We’re bringing Golmud into Battlefield Labs early as this will be a multi-session project. Through Labs, we want to test changes such as larger flight space, increased cover for aircraft, and other adjustments as the map evolves over time."

Lastly, EA and BF Studios did bring up the popular topic of a Solo Queue for its battle royale mode, REDSEC. While there's no indication that it'll be testing Solos in REDSEC anytime soon, the team is still testing it internally to help the team understand "where Solo play can best fit within the broader battle royale roster, including how it affects match flow, survivability, and long-term engagement when featured alongside other battle royale experiences."

"These tests are part of our ongoing effort to make informed decisions about how Battle Royale is structured and presented over time, rather than committing to a single permanent configuration. Any future player-facing testing would be approached with the goal of learning and validation, and we’ll share more details ahead of time if and when those tests are planned."

Upsetting as it is that we'll have to wait longer than expected for the arrival of Season 2, it's at least good to know what EA and the BF Studios teams are looking to test in the meantime. Now that we're more than a few months into Battlefield 6 being in players' hands, it's also interesting and encouraging to see BF Studios lean on BF Labs like this, so that players get the chance to try out what's coming to the game, and provide feedback that could, realistically, help EA avoid a season so collectively hated that it kills any momentum the game had.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/bf-labs-first-crack-testing-battlefield-6-new-map-bf4-map-rebuilt-for-todays-battlefield/

item.title: Chris Pratt Supposedly Hints At "A Couple More" Character Surprises In The Super Mario Galaxy Movie
item.content:encoded:
Rosalina, Bowser Jr. and..?

Similar to the Sonic movies, the Mario movies are expanding their big-screen universe by introducing and surprising audiences with more characters. Mario's companion Yoshi was teased at the end of the first movie, and since then, the official trailers for the Super Mario Galaxy Movie have introduced Bowser Jr. and Rosalina.

Speaking to GamesRadar+ recently, Mario's movie voice actor Chris Pratt has apparently hinted there are at least "a couple more" characters not featured in the official trailers for the new movie that should excite fans. Here's the full exchange:

"Oh, yes, there are," Pratt tells GamesRadar+ when we ask if there are any new characters he's looking forward to seeing in the finished film. "I'm not allowed to say what they are, but yes, there are some really incredible… Well, I think some of them have been released in the trailer – Rosalina, Bowser Jr. – and then there's even a couple more that are not in the trailer that people should be excited to see."

If Pratt is teasing a bigger cast of characters, there are plenty of friendly and not-so-friendly characters from the Mario video game universe that could pop up. One rumoured leak, dating back to last September, has led to speculation that Wario could be making an appearance.

You can see the current cast for the Super Mario Galaxy Movie in our guide. Nintendo and Illumination have also confirmed Rosalina will be voiced by Brie Larson and Bowser Jr. will be played by Benny Safdie.

Who else would you like to see show up in the Mario Galaxy Movie and possibly future entries? Tell us in the comments.

[source gamesradar.com, via nintendoeverything.com]

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply

item.title: ARC Raiders: Complete Guides and Walkthrough Hub
item.content:encoded:
ARC Raiders is a new third-person extraction shooter from Embark Studios, the same team that brought you the fast-paced FPS The Finals. ARC Raiders was actually intended to be Embark's debut game before the team decided to rework it entirely and focus on The Finals first, a bet that seemingly paid off now that ARC Raiders is one of the most popular games on the market today since it arrived in October 2025.

Table of contents

  • Gameplay Overview
  • Getting Started
  • Building Your Raider
  • Speranza Overview
  • Going Topside and Coming Home
  • Know Your ARCs
  • Review

Gameplay Overview

If you've played an extraction shooter before, the core concepts of ARC Raiders will be familiar to you. You jump into a large, expansive map, scavenge for resources and materials, raid and take down enemy players, and extract back to Speranza, the underground city you and every other raider call home.

Beyond enemy players, you'll also have to be wary of ARCs, the hostile machines that are the cause of the dystopian nature of the world. There are several different kinds of ARCs, and you can find out more about them below in the 'Know Your ARCs' section.

You can also find out more about ARCs and the gameplay in ARC Raiders in our upcoming Tips and Tricks, First 5 Things to Do, and Most Annoying ARCs - And How to Deal With Them guides.

Getting Started

When you first log into ARC Raiders, you'll go through a short tutorial that shows you a couple of gameplay basics, like how to move, shoot, breach doors, and search for resources. It's all very basic and seems to end very abruptly with one major lesson: you have to be aware of other Raiders. You learn this lesson when two unknown Raiders catch you by surprise, though, unlike in a regular match, because this is just the tutorial, you wake up after the screen fades to black and fades back in, and the tutorial continues.

From there, you continue until you reach an exit elevator and make your first trip to Speranza, the underground city that becomes your home. You'll be given what looks like a storage closet as your place to live, which you'll slowly build out into your ultimate post-apocalyptic home, and meet the first of the vendors you'll get quests and buy resources from.

An in-depth guide on what you should know before you start ARC Raiders will go live soon.

Building Your Raider

Creating the aesthetic of your character is, of course, a key part of the experience in any game. But what's really going to impact you in gameplay is your stats and what you take with you when you go up top.

You don't want to take anything with you that you would really regret losing, and you can't just keep rolling the dice with free loadouts. You need to figure out how to put a build together, particularly with where you put your early stats and what weapons you put stock in.

An in-depth guide on the best stats to level up first and weapons to use will go live soon.

Speranza Overview

Speranza is your home base of operations in ARC Raiders. It's where you look at and upgrade your Raider's stats, change your loadout, your outfit - it's where you do everything.

You cycle through the main lobby screen, your Workshop, your Raider, the Traders, Decks, and the in-game Store with the left and right bumpers. Your inventory, however, is always available on its own dedicated button. If you don't know what that button is, look to the bottom left of your screen.

When you're in your inventory menu, make sure to pay attention to the 'Actions' button. That's where you'll be able to decide on what to do with everything you find and store in your Stash. You also need to pay close attention to a small 'Expand' option that sits just above your inventory stack. That's where you upgrade your Stash, so it can hold more things.

An in-depth guide on how to make Speranza work for you in ARC Raiders will go live soon.

Going Topside and Coming Home

Of course, you can't upgrade your Raider, your gear, build out your home in Speranza; you can't do anything, if you can't survive a raid. Once you choose where to go, when you arrive you'll have approximately 30 minutes to grab what you can and make it back to an elevator to reach Speranza safely.

Each map will have multiple options for elevators or other ways back home, but they won't all be open to you for the whole match. One will remain available the entire time, but if you want the safest route home, you'll need to make it to an elevator in time.

An in-depth guide on how to buildcraft to survive topside and make it back home will go live soon.

Know Your ARCs

You should always be on the lookout for other players. Even with the reputation ARC Raiders has gained where plenty of players choose to play a more passive, PvE style, they're technically always a danger. But ARCs, the robots that stalk every inch of the map, those are the biggest danger of all.

That's why it's important to know your enemy; not just how to defeat it, but how to avoid it, and how to ensure you're always making it back home.

An in-depth guide on which ARCs you should know how to takedown with a hand behind your back will go live soon.

Review

For more on ARC Raiders, you can check out our full review and find out why Wccftech's Kai Tatsumoto gave it a 9/10.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/how-to/arc-raiders-complete-guides-and-walkthrough-hub/

item.title: D3 Publisher announces POOL ROOM BILLIARD for Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Out now via Nintendo eShop.

D3 Publisher has announced POOL ROOM BILLIARD for Switch 2. It is available now via Nintendo eShop for 1,980 yen. In Japan, it is known as SIMPLE Series for Nintendo Switch 2 Vol.2 THE Billiard. A physical edition (game-key card) will launch on April 2 in Japan for 2,980 yen.

Here is an overview of the game, via its official website:

About

Enjoy moody gameplay with motion controls using two Joy-Con 2 controllers. A full-fledged 3D billiards game where you can battle players worldwide online!

Feel Every Shot: Ultra-Realistic 3D Billiards Brings Motion-Controlled Cue Action to Nintendo Switch 2

Designed to capture the authentic sensation of real-world cue sports, the game blends precision physics, stylish presentation, and competitive online play for both casual players and dedicated billiards fans.

By wielding two Joy-Con 2 controllers, players can experience the natural feel of striking a cue ball—replicating the finesse, timing, and physical motion of real-life billiards. Set in sleek, pool bar–inspired environments, the game features classic 8-ball and 9-ball modes enhanced with ultra-realistic ball physics and refined visual detail.

Challenge the World in Online Billiards Battles

Players can compete with opponents worldwide through seamless online matchmaking, whether in fast Quick Matches or fully customizable Room Matches. Winning games earns ★ Skill Marks, letting players challenge others at similar skill levels. Voice chat via the C Button and fun mini-games while waiting make online play social and engaging.

Packed With Single-Player and Local Multiplayer Content

Beyond online play, Pool Room Billiard offers a variety of modes for every player. Battle adaptive AI in VS COM Mode, compete in Tournament Mode to test your skills, or enjoy local head-to-head matches in VS 2P Mode with motion or traditional controls. With lifelike motion controls, comprehensive gameplay modes, and worldwide online competition, this latest 3D billiards title delivers an authentic, accessible, and competitive cue sports experience—right from your living room.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

Announce Trailer

Japanese

Publisher PLAYISM and developer Adventurer’s Tavern have announced eight new collaborations coming to Maid Cafe on Electric Street alongside the game’s Switch release, including Wizardry: The Five Ordeals and titles from SNK.

The new collaborations are as follows:

  • Idol Manager (Glitch Pitch / PLAYISM)

  • La-Mulana 2 (NIGORO / PLAYISM)

The collaborations will be available in the Switch version of the game at launch, and added to the PC version at a later date.

Maid Cafe on Electric Street is available now for PC via Steam, and will launch for Switch on February 26.

item.title: Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster ‘Gameplay’ trailer, details, and screenshots
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Game loop and progression explained.

Inti Creates has released a new trailer, information, and screenshots for hybrid 2D action and strategy game Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster, detailing the game loop and progression.

Here are the details:

■ Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster

Kingdom’s Return is an action RPG where players must adventure to restore their fallen kingdom. Collect materials in 2D side-scrolling adventure stages, then use them in the strategy part to build your city as you see fit, and powering up your characters in the process!

Choose from one of four characters, Imperial, Alchemist, Wizard, or Zipangu, and set out on adventure through a variety of action stages. Collect the materials here you’ll use to build up your kingdom, placing buildings that buff your characters’ stats. Then set out again to conquer even more dangerous stages, until the bosses are afraid of you.

  • ❮
  • ❯

■ Gameplay Details

To solve the mystery behind the kingdom’s ruin, take on missions and set off for adventure!

Explore the world, and you’ll see monsters roaming around. You can either avoid them or seek out battles aggressively. By battling monsters, you’ll earn materials to use back at your kingdom.

Defeating enemies will also earn you experience points, raising the level of your adventurer. Leveling up will increase your parameters and make you stronger. You’ll also earn CP to spend on your Class Circle to unlock new abilities!

Succeed on your mission, and you can take your hard earned materials home with you safely.

In the strategy part of the game, use the materials you’ve gathered to build structures and restore the kingdom. Even from a lowly start, adventurers will get stronger and stronger by restoring their kingdom and adventuring.

Raise your levels on missions and set out on new adventures! Depending on how you build the kingdom and take on requests from residents, you can even change the ending of the story!

Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam on April 23.

Watch the trailer below. View the screenshots at the gallery.

Gameplay Introduction Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/kingdoms-return-time-eating-fruit-and-the-ancient-monster-gameplay-trailer-details-and-screenshots

item.title: Fantasista Asuka launches February 12
item.content:encoded:
■ About

Become the coach of a women’s soccer team and lead them to victory!

In this real-time soccer sim, play as the coach of a women’s soccer team tasked with guiding your eccentric players towards victory!
Gameplay for matches is simple and approachable, consisting of quick time events. Unlock new players and power up your team by winning heated matches against your rivals!

In addition, look forward to some mind-blowing rules you definitely won’t find in a real soccer match!
Draft your convention-busting dream team and shoot for the win!

■ Story

A chance encounter brings together Daisuke Aozora, a coach with ambitions to train a Japanese women’s soccer team that can compete on the world stage, and Asuka Tenma, a player from the bottom-ranked soccer club, the Golden Balls.

Seeing potential in Asuka, Daisuke decides to coach for the Golden Balls.

“I’ll guide you from the weakest to the strongest.”

From that one chance encounter… From that one promise… Asuka and her teammates’ fates begin to change.

The bottom-rank team’s miracle run…! Strap in for a soccer underdog epic filled with passion and perseverance!

■ System

Direct Your Players to Victory!

Players will constantly move on the pitch, with each of the player’s decisions greatly swaying the outcome of a match!
The plethora of actions available to the player such as shooting, tackling, and passing change depending on the situation and consume an energy called “vibes.” Overworking a single player will quickly cause them to run out vibes, greatly limiting their moves.

Utilizing substitutions and a division of labour, optimize your team’s output of vibes! Doing so is the shortest path to achieving victory.

Stack Wins and Draft the Ultimate Dream Team!

Winning a fierce match against a rival team will recruit its players into the Golden Balls! Additionally, characters can be powered up between matches through training.

Whether to build a solid all-round team or to focus on a specific niche, the strategy is all up to you, the coach. Train up your favorite players and create your very own dream team! Lead your team to hold up the league champion trophy!

Powerful Special Moves! Leaving Uniforms in Tatters?!

Specific players have special moves which are more powerful than regular shooting, dribbling, and tackling!

However, since they consume large amounts of vibes, figuring out the pivotal moments in which to activate these abilities is the key to victory. When a player lands a special move, their uniform is for some reason left in tatters!

Players with damaged uniforms must temporarily leave the pitch in order to change, leaving your team a player short! Determine when to optimally use your special moves to grasp victory!

No Hard Feelings! The Heartfelt Uniform Exchange!

When you defeat a rival team, exchange uniforms after the match in an act of sportsmanship! It is a sign of friendship and mutual respect only open to those who gave their all during the match. But no weird looks! Those who do will be handed an immediate red card and be asked to leave!

Let the Light Protect You! No More Red Cards on Social Media!

A heavenly light beams down to protect the maidens’ sensitive areas! Turn this feature on and you can elegantly dodge getting a red card on video streaming services or social media…maybe!

*Please note that even with this feature enabled, there is still a possibility that a platform will remove your video or ban your account.

■ Feature Comparisons

The features listed below will look different depending on the platform.

  • Uniform Exchange Illustrations
    • Switch – Amount of Skin Showing: Small
    • PC – Amount of Skin Showing: Large
  • Uniform Destruction Illustrations
    • Switch – Amount of Skin Showing: Small
    • PC – Amount of Skin Showing: Large

Watch a gameplay video below.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/fantasista-asuka-launches-february-12
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Mario Kart World version 1.5.0 update now available
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Adds team races to Knockout Tour when playing in a room during online and wireless play.

Nintendo has released the version 1.5.0 update for Mario Kart World, which adds team races to Knockout Tour when playing in a room during online and wireless play.

Here are the full patch notes:

General

  • Added team races to Knockout Tour when playing in a room during “Online Play” and “Wireless Play.”
  • The game now supports the Polish language.
    • Note: You can change your selected language using the “Language” setting in the “System” menu of “System Settings.”

Fixed Issues

  • Fixed an issue where the game would sometimes end if a player plays as Kamek on Choco Mountain.
  • Fixed an issue where the displayed rating would sometimes be incorrect when joining “Everyone” in “Online Play” while in a room.
  • Several other issues have been addressed to improve the gameplay experience.

Mario Kart World is available now for Switch 2.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/mario-kart-world-version-1-5-0-update-now-available
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Pokémon Legends Z-A Version 2.0.1 Is Now Live, Here Are The Full Patch Notes
item.content:encoded:
Including multiple fixes for Mega Dimension

Pokémon Legends: Z-A has received its first update of the year today for the Switch and Switch 2. When you download it, your copy will be updated to Version 2.0.1.

It focuses on some adjustments for obtaining certain items (including an increase to the maximum number of Mega Shards) and also applies a whole bunch of fixes to previously confirmed Mega Dimension expansion issues. You can read more about this in a separate post on Nintendo's support site.

Here's the rundown of this latest update:

Pokémon Legends: Z-A: Ver. 2.0.1 (Released January 21, 2026)

Adjustments Applied for Obtaining Items:

  • When purchasing Berries from a food stall, you can now purchase multiple Berries at once.
  • After beginning the story of the Pokémon Legends: Z-A – Mega Dimension DLC, you will be able purchase Berries from the clerk at Nouveau Café’s Truck No. 3.
  • The maximum number of Mega Shards you can carry has been increased from 999 to 9,999.

Fixes Applied for the Following Confirmed Issues Related to Pokémon Legends: Z-A – Mega Dimension Content:

  • When using moves in certain pockets of hyperspace, Pokémon may sometimes have faced a different direction from the intended target.
  • There were cases in which the weather remained sunny and did not change.
  • Shiny Pokémon obtained prior to the release of Pokémon Legends: Z-A – Mega Dimension may not have been registered to the Mega Evolution Pokédex, even if their Mega Stones were obtained after becoming available in the DLC.
  • During missions, images from unrelated scenes may occasionally have been displayed.
  • Players may not have been able to complete side mission 188 “Start Special Scanning!” even after earning the maximum number of survey points. (Players who are already experiencing this issue should be able to progress after entering and exiting hyperspace.)

In case you missed it, the Mega Dimension expansion DLC for Pokémon Legends: Z-A released at the end of last year. Unfortunately, it didn't exactly live up to our expectations here at Nintendo Life, with repetitive Hyperspace dimensions and bland level design, but it's hard to resist the lure of an expanded Pokédex.

You can find out what else we had to say about it in our full review:

Nintendo has also released new updates for Mario Kart World and Donkey Kong Bananza today, and yesterday rolled out a surprise update for Donkey Kong Country Returns HD.

Have you downloaded this update for Pokémon Legends: Z-A? Have you played through Mega Dimension yet? Tell us in the comments.

[source en-americas-support.nintendo.com]

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply

item.title: Donkey Kong Bananza Version 3.1.0 Update Now Live, Here Are The Patch Notes
item.content:encoded:
It's been a busy week for DK

Alongside an update to Mario Kart World today, Nintendo has also released its first patch of 2026 for Donkey Kong Bananza.

It also adds Polish language support. According to the patch notes, "several other issues" have been addressed to improve the overall experience, but as usual, no additional information has been shared. If we hear anything about this, we'll provide an update.

Here are the full patch notes via Nintendo's official support page:

Donkey Kong Bananza: Version 3.1.0 (Released January 21, 2026)

General

  • Added Polish as a supported language. If you set the language to “Polish/English” in the Nintendo Switch 2 system, the text will become Polish.
    • The audio is English.
  • Several other issues have been addressed to improve the gameplay experience.

In case you missed it, Nintendo is also currently hosting an in-game event for Donkey Kong's Emerald Rush DLC, where you can unlock two new statues. And yesterday it released a surprise update for Donkey Kong Country Returns HD, adding Dixie Kong as well as some enhancements for the game on the Switch 2.

Have you downloaded this latest update for Donkey Kong Bananza? Have you tried out the new update for Donkey Kong Country Returns HD yet? Let us know in the comments.

[source en-americas-support.nintendo.com]

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

item.title: Mario Kart World Has Been Updated To Version 1.5.0, Here Are The Full Patch Notes
item.content:encoded:
Download this update on Switch 2 today

Nintendo has released the first update for Mario Kart World this year, and it bumps the latest racing entry up to Version 1.5.0.

This update makes some general changes and also addresses multiple issues. This includes Team Races in Knockout Tour and the addition of Polish language support. Here's the full rundown, courtesy of Nintendo's official support page.

As always, if anything else significant is discovered going on behind the scenes, we'll be sure to let you know.

Mario Kart World: Version 1.5.0 (Released January 21, 2026)

General

  • Added team races to Knockout Tour when playing in a room during “Online Play” and “Wireless Play”.
  • The game now supports the Polish language.
    • Note: You can change your selected language using the “Language” setting in the “System” menu of “System Settings.”

Fixed Issues

  • Fixed an issue where the game would sometimes end if a player plays as Kamek on Choco Mountain.
  • Fixed an issue where the displayed rating would sometimes be incorrect when joining “Everyone” in “Online Play” while in a room.
  • Several other issues have been addressed to improve the gameplay experience.

Nintendo also recently released some Mario Kart World-themed Switch Online icons, with a total of five waves running from now until February.

Apart from this update for Mario Kart this week, it's also released new updates today for Donkey Kong Bananza and Pokémon Legends: Z-A. Yesterday, Donkey Kong Country Returns HD got a surprise update as well.

Have you downloaded this update for Mario Kart World yet? How are you finding the game so far? Let us know in the comments.

[source en-americas-support.nintendo.com]

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.
